org.apache.mesos.reconciliation

Interface Reconciler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultReconciler

    public interface Reconciler
    Interface for a task Reconciler, which synchronizes the Framework's task state with what Mesos reports (with Mesos treated as source of truth).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void forceComplete()
      Forces reconciliation into a complete state.
      boolean isReconciled()
      Returns whether reconciliation is complete.
      void reconcile(SchedulerDriver driver)
      Triggers any needed reconciliation against the provided driver.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> remaining()
      Returns the set of known unreconciled task ids as Strings.
      void start()
      Starts reconciliation against the provided tasks, which should represent what the Scheduler currently knows about task status.
      void update(TaskStatus status)
      Used to update the Reconciler with current task status.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Starts reconciliation against the provided tasks, which should represent what the Scheduler currently knows about task status.

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS

      • reconcile

        void reconcile(SchedulerDriver driver)
        Triggers any needed reconciliation against the provided driver. This call is expected to occur multiple times throughout the lifespan of the scheduler. It SHOULD be invoked each time that the scheduler receives a TaskStatus update or an Offer.

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS

        Parameters:
        driver - The SchedulerDriver instance that the Reconciler should use to query the Mesos master for TaskStatus.

      • update

        void update(TaskStatus status)
        Used to update the Reconciler with current task status. This is effectively an asynchronous callback which is triggered by a call to reconcile().

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS

        Parameters:
        status - The TaskStatus used to update the Reconciler.

      • isReconciled

        boolean isReconciled()
        Returns whether reconciliation is complete.

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS

      • remaining

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> remaining()
        Returns the set of known unreconciled task ids as Strings. Note that an empty list does NOT mean that reconciliation is complete. Use isReconciled() to determine completeness.

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS

        See Also:
        isReconciled()

      • forceComplete

        void forceComplete()
        Forces reconciliation into a complete state. This may result in inconsistent task state between Mesos and the Framework Scheduler, so calling it is not recommended.

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS
